intro: Jasione laevis subsp. laevis, commonly known as the smooth yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It produces small, hairy fruits called achenes, which are dispersed by wind. Jasione laevis subsp. laevis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
